author: cnbc.com
title: Corium: Fiscal 2Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
MENLO PARK, Calif. (AP) _ Corium International Inc. (CORI) on Monday reported a loss of $18 million in its fiscal second quarter.
On a per-share basis, the Menlo Park, California-based company said it had a loss of 50 cents.
The biopharmaceutical company posted revenue of $10.1 million in the period.
Corium shares have decreased nearly 6 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Monday, shares hit $9.06, a rise of 60 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on CORI at https://www.zacks.com/ap/CORI
